qas.question: By what time period had many of the Jewish  population joined the Holy Roman Empire?
The Jewish populations upon migrating into the German society mingled languages to form what new language?
What cause the tolerance and mixing  into German Society to end for the Jews?
What language did many of the Jews speak after the crusades?
What language did the Jews speak prior to assimilating into German culture?
After assimilating to German culture, what language did the Jews adopt?
What happened to the Jews during the crusades?
What group assimilated into German culture following the Middle Ages?
What sped up Jewish assimilation into German society?
Who migrated to Germany during the Crusades?
Where was Yiddish spoken after the Crusades?

context: By the <a0_0>Middle Ages<a0_0/>, large numbers of <b8_0>Jews<b8_0/> lived in the Holy Roman Empire and had assimilated into German culture, including many Jews who had previously assimilated into French culture and had spoken a mixed <a4_0>Judeo-French<a4_0/> language. Upon assimilating into German culture, the Jewish German peoples incorporated major parts of the German language and elements of other European languages into a mixed language known as <a1_0><a5_0>Yiddish<a1_0/>.<a5_0/> However tolerance and assimilation of Jews in German society suddenly ended <a6_0>during the <a2_0><b9_0>Crusades<b9_0/><a6_0/><a2_0/> with many <b10_0>Jews<b10_0/> being <a7_0>forcefully expelled from Germany<a7_0/> and Western Yiddish disappeared as a language in <b11_0>Germany<b11_0/> over the centuries, with German Jewish people fully adopting the <a3_0>German<a3_0/> language.
